com.nokia.mid.ui.frameanimator
Interface FrameAnimatorListener

public interface FrameAnimatorListener

Interface to receive animation-updates. See also FrameAnimator.

Method Summary
 void animate(FrameAnimator animator, int x, int y, short delta, short deltaX, short deltaY, boolean lastFrame)
          This method is called to describe an animation.
 

Method Detail

animate

void animate(FrameAnimator animator,
             int x,
             int y,
             short delta,
             short deltaX,
             short deltaY,
             boolean lastFrame)
This method is called to describe an animation. The platform can call this method one or more times as a result of the application triggering an animation via FrameAnimator.drag(int x, int y) or FrameAnimator.kineticScroll(int startSpeed, int direction, int friction, float angle). In each call, the current state of the animation is described via x and y, which are absolute values, and computed from the initial coordinates passed to FrameAnimator.register(int x, int y, short maxFps, short maxPps, FrameAnimatorListener listener) and the actual animation-properties. After an animation has ended, the coordinates are still maintained as long as the FrameAnimator is registered. Therefore a new animation will start off where the last one has stopped.

Parameters:
animator - The FrameAnimator that caused the animation
x - the new x-coordinate
y - the new y-coordinate
delta - the distance from the previous x/y coordinate
deltaX - the distance between previous and current x coordinate
deltaY - the distance between previous and current y coordinate
lastFrame - true if this is the last frame of an ongoing animation, false if more calls are going to follow.
